title: CLO-Based STEM Language Education Innovation: Cognitive Load-Optimized Instructional Design and Text·Vocabulary Structuring Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic STEM concepts, understanding of general instructional design principles, and intermediate language proficiency (academic grammar, STEM vocabulary, complex text comprehension)
context.additional_context: Learners possess intermediate expertise in the language domain (academic writing, complex text comprehension, presentation expression) and are evaluated on their ability to design CLO schemas and verify language learning effectiveness through project-based assessments. Includes real-time collaboration (Google Docs, Padlet) and text-based communication activities (chat, forums) using personal devices (BYOD).

learning_goals: Apply CLO schema core principles to design and analyze text structures (introduction-body-conclusion) and hierarchical vocabulary systems (basic-intermediate-advanced) in STEM language education materials.

Apply relational knowledge structuring strategies (schema mapping, concept linking) for cognitive load optimization to STEM language learning scenarios, enhancing academic expression and complex text comprehension.

Through team-based projects, learners develop language learning instructional design solutions reflecting three CLOs (grammar accuracy, vocabulary diversity, discourse coherence). They submit reports demonstrating language learning effectiveness (≥4/5 on evaluation scale) and communication skill improvement (≥20% pre-post test gains) via peer review and expert evaluation.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
